snippet: General Electric reported a better-than-expected 7.5 percent increase in fourth-quarter profit and a sharp increase in its backlog of equipment orders.
abstract: General Electric reports better-than-expected 7.5 percent increase in fourth-quarter profit and sharp increase in its backlog of equipment orders; fourth-quarter earnings rose to $4.01 billion, or 38 cents a share, compared with $3.73 billion, or 35 cents a share, in period a year earlier; revenue rose 3.6 percent, to $39.33 billion from $37.97 billion a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: General Electric reported a better-than-expected 7.5 percent increase in fourth-quarter profit and a sharp increase in its backlog of equipment orders.

headline.seo: G.E. Profit Is Lifted by Jet Engines and Energy Equipment
headline.main: Jet Engines and Energy Equipment Lift Profit at G.E.
headline.print_headline: Jet Engines and Energy Equipment Lift Profit at G.E.
